content.title: Monetary Relief to the Victim of Atrocities- Haryana
content.department: Directorate of Welfare of Scheduled Caste & Backward Classes, Government of Haryana
content.beneficiary: Members of Scheduled Caste who become victims of atrocities
content.details: The scheme 'Monetary Relief to the Victim of Atrocities' provides financial assistance ranging from ₹85,000/- to ₹8,25,000/- to members of Scheduled Caste who become victims of atrocities by Non-Scheduled Caste persons for various acts such as damage and loss of properties, grievous hurt, temporary/permanent incapacitation, murder, death, rape, gang rape, kidnapping, and outrage of modesty. An FIR must be registered under the provisions of SC/ST(PoA) Act, 1989.
benefits: Direct deposit of financial assistance into the bank accounts of the victim or family/dependent of the victim
eligibility: The applicant must be a permanent resident of Haryana.
The applicant must be a victim, or a family member/dependent of a victim, of an atrocity committed by non-Scheduled Caste persons.
The applicant must belong to the Scheduled Caste or Scheduled Tribe community.
An FIR must be lodged under the SC/ST Prevention of Atrocities Act, 1989.
content.application_process: Online application through the Antyodaya-SARAL Portal.
documents_required: Identity/ Citizenship Proof (Ration card, Domicile Certificate, Aadhaar)
Resident Proof/Address Proof/Ownership Proof (Ration Card, Domicile Certificate, Aadhaar Card)

faqs.question: Who implements this scheme?
faqs.answer: The Directorate of Welfare of Scheduled Caste & Backward Classes, Government of Haryana, implements this scheme.

faqs.question: What types of atrocities are covered under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Atrocities such as damage and loss of properties, grievous hurt, temporary/permanent incapacitation, murder, death, rape, gang rape, kidnapping, and outrage of modesty are covered.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Permanent residents of Haryana who belong to the Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe community and are victims or family/dependents of victims of atrocities by Non-Scheduled Caste persons are eligible.

faqs.question: Is an FIR required to apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, an FIR must be lodged under the SC/ST Prevention of Atrocities Act, 1989.

faqs.question: How can one apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Applications can be submitted through the Antyodaya-SARAL Portal.

faqs.question: What is the minimum amount of financial assistance provided under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The minimum amount of financial assistance is ₹85,000/-.

faqs.question: What is the maximum amount of financial assistance provided under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The maximum amount of financial assistance is ₹8,25,000/-.

faqs.question: How is the financial assistance disbursed?
faqs.answer: The financial assistance is directly deposited into the bank account of the victim or the family/dependent of the victim.

faqs.question: Is this scheme applicable to non-Scheduled Caste victims?
What documents are required to apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Applicants need to provide proof of residence, caste certificate, FIR copy, and bank account details, etc.

faqs.question: What acts govern the provisions of this scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme is governed by the SC/ST Prevention of Atrocities Act, 1989, and the SC/ST (PoA) Rules, 1995.
